ygData.subject: Trouble running Fortran - Cantera interface
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello.. I am trying to link my Fortran program to Cantera.  I built and installed Cantera from the source code using Visual C++ .NET, then I found the f77demo

Subject: Trouble running Fortran - Cantera interface
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=222852018; y=LMG5dHD3fXe8gMFmbZh1nxbHStCmc20Xk5rg_rR4x1lm0W9EZvuIwLU

Hello.. I am trying to link my Fortran program to Cantera.  I built 
and installed Cantera from the source code using Visual C++ .NET, 
then I found the f77demo project under the source code download 
directory:  cantera-1.5.5\tools\templates\f77.  

I have Compaq Visual Fortran 6.6.a installed, which is what I 
created my original Fortran program on.  I tried opening and 
building the f77demo project, but the header files (idealgasmix.h, 
etc) could not be located.  I fixed this by changing the paths to 
the header files in the demo_ftnlib.cpp file to 
C:\Cantera\include\cantera\***.h, which is where the Cantera 
installation apparently puts them.  This fixed that problem, but now 
I get a bunch of "unresolved external symbol" errors.   

The readme file included in the f77demo project folder states that I 
can just open the project file and build it because Compaq Visual 
Fortran 6.0 and Microsoft Visual C++ 6.0 share a common development 
environment (Visual Studio).  Is this not the case with Visual 
C++ .NET?  

It is my understanding that I need to create the .obj file from the 
demo_ftnlib.cpp and run the included makefile to link that .obj file 
to the one created by the Fortran program.  If this is not what is 
supposed to happen, please let me know.  Obviously at this point, I 
am having trouble just creating the object file from the 
demo.ftnlib.cpp file.
 
As you can probably tell, my programming experience is very 
limited.  If someone can point me in the right direction to get the 
demo program working it would be greatly appreciated!
